translation.en: Dear Mr. Stevens:
You will be surprised to hear from me after all this time.
You've been in my thoughts since I heard Lord Darlington had died.
translation.ko: 달링턴 경의 사망 소식을 듣고 연락해야겠다고 생각했습니다

translation.en: We read that his heirs put Darlington Hall up for sale...
...as they no longer wished to maintain it.
As no one would buy such a large house...
translation.ko: 그렇게 규모가 큰집을 살 사람도 없으니

translation.en: ...the new earl decided to demolish it and sell the stone for 5000 pounds.
translation.ko: 그 집을 헐어서 건축상에게 석재를 5,000파운드에 판다고 들었습니다

translation.en: We also saw some rubbish in the Daily Mail which made my blood boil:
translation.ko: '데일리 메일'에 난 기사를 보고 분노가 치밀어 올랐습니다

translation.en: "Traitor's nest to be pulled down."
One hundred and eighty guineas?
One hundred and eighty? Have we done?
Ladies and gentlemen, a great highlight of the sale:
...the fine Elizabethan portrait, A Portly Gentleman.
I'll start the bidding at 2000 guineas.
Two thousand guineas, thank you.
Two-two.
Two-four.
Two-six.
Two-eight.
Three thousand, three-two, three-four, three-six.
Four thousand guineas. Four and a half thousand.
Five thousand.
And a half.
Six thousand.
And a half.
Seven thousand.
And a half.
Eight thousand.
And a half.
Nine thousand.
And a half.
Ten thousand guineas is bid.
And a half.
Eleven thousand.
And a half.
Against you, sir, at eleven and a half thousand guineas.
All done at eleven and a half thousand guineas.
I was very relieved to read how an American millionaire...
translation.ko: 다행스럽게 생각하는 건 그 미국인 백만장자

translation.en: ...named Lewis saved Darlington Hall...
...so you wouldn't be turned out of your home after all.
translation.ko: 그렇게 되면 당신도 계속 거기 있을 수 있겠군요

translation.en: Is it the same Congressman Lewis...
...who attended His Lordship's conference in 1936?
Mr. Stevens, I so often think of the good old days...
translation.ko: 요즘은 종종 그 집에서 일했던 시절이

translation.en: ...when I was the housekeeper.
It was hard work...
...and I have known butlers easier to please than our Mr. Stevens...
...but those years with you were among the happiest of my life.
translation.ko: 그래도 당신과 있던 그때가 가장 행복했습니다

translation.en: You must have a completely different staff now.
Not many of the old faces around anymore.
There's not much need for the small army of footmen...
translation.ko: 달링턴 경이 있었을 때처럼 많은 하인들이

translation.en: ...that Lord Darlington employed.
My own news is not very cheerful.
In the 7 years since I last wrote, I have again left my husband...
translation.ko: 7년 전 마지막 편지를 드린 이후로 남편과 다시 헤어졌어요

translation.en: ...and, sad to say, my marriage seems to be over.
translation.ko: 슬픈 일이지만 결혼생활은 끝난 거 같아요

translation.en: I'm staying at a friend's boarding house in Clevedon.
translation.ko: 클레브돈에 있는 친구 하숙집에 머물고 있어요

translation.en: I don't know what my future is.
Since Catherine, my daughter, got married, my life has been empty.
translation.ko: 딸 캐서린이 시집간 이후로는 인생이 적막하기만 합니다

translation.en: The years stretch before me and if only I knew how to fill them.
translation.ko: 예측할 수 없는 인생을 어떻게 보낼지 걱정입니다

translation.en: But I would like to be useful again.
-Burned again? -Yes, I'm sorry, sir.
The rule in the kitchen has always been...
...cook cooks the cooked breakfast while her assistant toasts the toast.
translation.ko: 주방장이 요리하고 보조가 토스트를 굽게 되어 있어서요

translation.en: Why don't we get her a pop-up toaster?
We need not a new gadget but a revised staff plan, sir.
A staff plan, huh? I didn't know we had one.
translation.ko: 역할 분담? 그런 게 있는 줄 몰랐는데

translation.en: A faulty one, unfortunately.
Sir, quite recently...
...you were kind enough to suggest that I go on a little holiday trip...
translation.ko: 제게 며칠간 지방으로 휴가를 가는 게

translation.en: ...around the country.
Absolutely. Certainly, take a break. See the world.
translation.ko: 자네 쉴 때가 됐어 세상 구경 좀 하고 와

translation.en: Thank you, sir.
When did you last see the world?
translation.ko: 마지막으로 바깥구경을 한 게 언제지? 말해봐

translation.en: The world always used to come to this house, if I may say so.
translation.ko: 과거에는 이 집안에서도 세상을 볼 수 있었습니다

translation.en: You may say so.
Take off when I'm in London next week.
translation.ko: 다음 주 내가 런던에 갈 때 다녀오지 그러나?

translation.en: I tell you what, you take the car.
-Take the Daimler. -Good Lord, sir, I couldn't.
You and that Daimler belong together.
You were made for each other.
That's most kind of you, I must say, sir. Most kind.
I'd meant to travel the West, where I understand we have splendid scenery.
translation.ko: 서부를 돌아볼까 합니다 가장 멋진 경관을 가졌다고 생각하는 곳이죠

translation.en: And I might incidentally be able to solve our problems while I'm there.
translation.ko: 어쩌면 거기서 역할분담 문제를 해결할 수 있을지 모르겠습니다

translation.en: A former housekeeper, at present living in Clevedon, has indicated...
...that she might be prepared to return to service.
What's this, your girlfriend?
Or a former attachment?
Oh, no, sir.
No, but a very able housekeeper.
A most able housekeeper.
I was just kidding, Stevens.
Sorry.
You know what I like best about your papers?
These obituaries.
Every son of a gun gets this stately funeral oration.
translation.ko: 아무것도 아닌 자들까지 대단했던 것처럼 말하거든

translation.en: -It's not an art we have in the States. -Indeed, sir.
Thank you, Stevens.
Mr. Lewis.
Dear Mrs. Benn...
...I propose to reach Clevedon on October 3rd around 4 p.m.
I'd be grateful for a line from you...
...to reach me at the post office at Collingbourne, near Hungerford...
translation.ko: 잠시 들를 예정이니 컬링본에 있는 우체국으로

translation.en: ...where I'm planning to stop.
Mrs. Benn, I always said you possess an amazing memory.
translation.ko: 벤 부인, 정말 잘 기억하고 계시더군요

translation.en: Our new employer is indeed Congressman Lewis...
...though he's now retired from political life in the U.S.
He's taken up residence at Darlington Hall, soon to be joined by his family.
translation.ko: 이곳 달링턴 성에서 살고 계십니다 곧 가족들과도 함께하실 겁니다

translation.en: But I regret to say we are woefully understaffed for a house this size.
translation.ko: 이 커다란 저택에 하인 수가 턱없이 부족합니다

translation.en: Mrs. Benn, will you permit me once again to sing your praises?
Let me state that when you left to get married...
translation.ko: 당신이 결혼을 하러 우리를 떠난 이후

translation.en: ...no housekeeper ever reached your high standard in any department.
translation.ko: 어떤 면에서건 아직 당신만 한 총무를 만나지 못했습니다

translation.en: I well remember your arrival at Darlington Hall.
translation.ko: 당신이 처음 이곳에 오던 날을 아직도 기억합니다

translation.en: You came somewhat unexpectedly, one might even say impulsively...
...while we were dead in the middle of the Charlgrove meet.
translation.ko: 한참 사냥 시즌으로 모두 정신이 없을 때였죠

translation.en: That day is marked in my memory in another way as well.
translation.ko: 그 날을 아직도 생생하게 기억하고 있습니다

translation.en: It was the last time His Lordship...
...was happy to welcome his neighbors, as in the old days.
translation.ko: 이웃들과 즐거운 시간을 보내시고 있을 때였습니다

translation.en: Of course, it had been years since any of them had coaxed him to hunt.
translation.ko: 물론, 지난 몇 년간 아무도 주인님과 사냥을 하지 않았었죠

translation.en: It was never a sport His Lordship enjoyed or approved of.
-Good morning, Ayres. -My lord, nice to see you.
Excuse me, sir.
I fear I may have been a little unwelcoming, even a little short.
translation.ko: 처음에는 별로 달가워하지 않는 듯 보였을 겁니다

translation.en: You presented the best references I've ever seen.
Which proved to be well-deserved.
Though, I confess, I did have my doubts, on account of your youth.
translation.ko: 하지만 나는 당신이 너무 어리다고 생각했었습니다

translation.en: No gentlemen callers allowed, of course.
Forgive my mentioning it, but we've had those problems before.
translation.ko: 이런 말 해서 미안하지만 전에도 문제가 있었소

translation.en: Inside the house too.
The previous housekeeper ran off with the under-butler.
translation.ko: 전에 있던 총무가 집사 보조와 달아났죠

translation.en: If two staff members decide to get married, one can say nothing.
translation.ko: 만약 두 사람이 사랑을 하고 결혼하고자 한다면 문제 될 게 없지만

translation.en: What I find a major irritation...
...are those persons who go from post to post looking for romance.
translation.ko: 불장난을 위한 로맨스를 찾는 거라면 절대로 용납이 안 됩니다

translation.en: Housekeepers are particularly guilty here.
-No offense intended, of course. -None taken.
I know how a house is at sixes and sevens once the staff start marrying.
translation.ko: 집안이 문란해지면 곧 엉망이 되는 것 저도 잘 압니다

translation.en: Yes, indeed.
-Might I have a word, sir? -Of course.
My lord, it's regarding the under-butler...
...and the housekeeper who ran off last month.
Bad business. How are you managing?
I've found two first-rate replacements.
Miss Kenton, a young woman with excellent references.
Very pleasing demeanor. Appears to be very able.
translation.ko: 품행이 방정하고 또 매우 유능해 보입니다

translation.en: And a man with considerable experience.
-Older and happy to be under-butler. -Name?
translation.ko: 나이는 좀 있지만 집사 보조 일을 하겠답니다 이름은?

translation.en: Stevens, sir.
-Stevens? -Yes, sir.
-That's your name. -He's my father, sir.
Really?
Couldn't do better. I'd like to see him sometime.
He's outside the door.
Good. Bring him in.
Thank you, my lord.
Father.
Mr. Stevens, how do you do?
-My lord. -Very good man here, your son.
He serves the house well. I don't know what we'd do without him.
translation.ko: 집안에 없으면 안 될 만큼 많은 도움을 받고 있습니다

translation.en: -Proud of him? -Very, my lord.
Quite right too.
Yes.
Glad to have you with us.
Thank you, my lord.
-Oh, Stevens.... -Sir?
What are we at dinner tonight? Fourteen? Sixteen?
translation.ko: 오늘 저녁 식사엔 몇 명이나 오는 거지, 14? 16?

translation.en: -Twelve, sir. -Right.
Thank you, my lord.
-Oh, Mr. Stevens. -Yes?
-This pitcher seems out of place here. -Dining room. Well spotted.
translation.ko: 이 은주전자는 제자리에 있는 게 아닌 것 같군요 식당 거요 좋은 지적이오

translation.en: -Hello, William, how are you? -Good day, Miss Kenton.
translation.ko: - 윌리엄, 안녕하세요? - 좋은 날입니다, 켄턴 양

translation.en: -Hello. -Mr. Stevens.
I thought these might brighten your parlor.
translation.ko: 여기 두면 보기 좋을 것 같네요

translation.en: Beg your pardon?
They might cheer things up for you.
That's very kind of you.
If you like, I could bring in some more for you.
translation.ko: 맘에 드시면 조금 더 갖다 드릴게요

translation.en: Thank you...
...but I regard this room as my private place of work...
translation.ko: 하지만 여긴 내 개인적인 업무 장소이고

translation.en: ...and I prefer to keep distractions to a minimum.
Would you call flowers a distraction, then?
I appreciate your kindness. I prefer to keep things as they are.
translation.ko: 친절에는 감사하지만 난 자연 그대로가 좋소

translation.en: But since you are here, there is a small matter I wanted to mention.
I happened to be walking past the kitchen yesterday morning...
...and I heard you call to someone named William.
translation.ko: 당신이 누군가를 윌리엄이라 부르는 걸 들었소

translation.en: May I ask who you were addressing by that name?
I should think I was addressing your father.
There are no other Williams in this house.
True.
May I ask you in future to address my father as Mr. Stevens?
translation.ko: 앞으로는 내 아버지를 지칭할 때 스티븐스 씨라고 해주겠소?

translation.en: If speaking of him to a third party, you may call him...
...Mr. Stevens Sr. to distinguish him from myself.
So I would be most grateful to you, Miss Kenton.
I don't quite understand what you're getting at.
translation.ko: 무슨 말씀이신지 잘 이해가 안 가는군요

translation.en: I am the housekeeper in this house, and your father is the under-butler.
translation.ko: 전 이 집의 총무고 당신 아버지는 집사 보조입니다

translation.en: I am accustomed to addressing under- servants by their Christian names.
translation.ko: 전 제 하급자들에겐 늘 그냥 이름을 부릅니다

translation.en: If you would stop to think for a moment...
...you'd realize how inappropriate it is...
...for one such as yourself to address as William...
translation.ko: 아버지뻘 되는 분께 그렇게 이름을 부르는 게

translation.en: ...someone such as my father.
translation.ko: 옳지 않다는 걸 알게 될 거요

translation.en: It must have been very galling for your father to be called William...
translation.ko: 저처럼 천한 것이 당신 아버지 이름을 불렀으니

translation.en: ...by one such as myself.
My father is a person from whom...
...if you'd observe him more, you may learn things.
translation.ko: 당신도 많은 것을 배울 수 있을 겁니다

translation.en: I'm grateful for your advice, but do tell me...
...what things might I learn from him?
translation.ko: 제가 뭘 배울 수 있다는 거죠?

translation.en: I might point out that you're...
...often unsure of what goes where and which item is which.
translation.ko: 소품의 위치나 집기의 용도에 대해 모르잖소

translation.en: I'm sure Mr. Stevens Sr. is very good at his job...
...but I can assure you that I'm very good at mine.
translation.ko: 저도 제 일에 있어서는 확실하다고 생각합니다

translation.en: -Of course. -Thank you.
If you will please excuse me.
Miss Kenton....
Oh, well.
My compliments to cook.
What a lovely piece of crackling.
I'm sure you said something witty. Share it with the rest of us.
translation.ko: 재미있는 말을 한 거 같은데 우리도 좀 같이 웃는 게 어떤가?

translation.en: I said the sprouts is done the way I like them. Crisp-like, not mushy.
translation.ko: 야채가 입맛에 맞게 빠삭하게 잘 익었다고요

translation.en: Sprouts "are" done, not "is" done.
Isn't that right, George?
Yes, Mr. Stevens.
Forgive the correction, as I would have done...
...at your age for the sake of my education.
translation.ko: 자네 나이 때는 뭐든 배워두는 게 좋을 걸세

translation.en: I'm sure even you have ambitions to rise in your profession.
translation.ko: 자네도 출세하고 싶은 야망이 있을 거 아닌가

translation.en: Oh, yes. I want to be a butler, to be called Mister...
...sit in my own pantry by my own fire, smoking my cigar.
translation.ko: 제 집무실에 앉아 담배를 피워보고 싶습니다

translation.en: I wonder if you realize what it takes to be a great butler?
Takes dignity, that's what it takes.
Thank you, Mr. Stevens. Dignity, that's right. Dignity.
The definition from our quarterly The Gentlemen's Gentleman:
A great butler must be possessed of dignity--
In keeping with his position.
There was this English butler in India.
translation.ko: 인도의 어떤 영국인 집사는 어느 날

translation.en: One day, he goes in the dining room and what's under the table?
translation.ko: 식당으로 들어가다가 식탁 밑에서 뭔가를 봤네

translation.en: A tiger.
Not turning a hair, he goes to the drawing room.
translation.ko: 전혀 놀라는 기색 없이 곧장 주인에게 가서는

translation.en: "Excuse me, my lord," and whispering, so as not to upset the ladies:
translation.ko: 부인들이 듣지 않게 작은 목소리로 말을 했다네

translation.en: "I'm sorry. There appears to be a tiger in the dining room.
translation.ko: "죄송하지만 지금 식당에 호랑이 한 마리가 있는데"

translation.en: Perhaps His Lordship will permit use of the twelve-bores?"
They go on drinking their tea. And then, there's three gunshots.
translation.ko: 손님들은 차를 마시고 있었고 이어 세 발의 총성이 울렸지

translation.en: They don't think nothing of it. In India, they're used to anything.
translation.ko: 인도에서 총성은 별일 아니라서 손님들은 신경도 쓰지 않았어

translation.en: When the butler is back to refresh the teapots...
...he says, cool as a cucumber:
"Dinner will be served at the usual time, my lord.
And I am pleased to say there will be no discernible traces left...
...of the recent occurrence by that time."
I'll repeat it. "There will be no discernible traces left...
...of the recent occurrence by that time."
-Wonderful, Mr. Stevens. -Thank you, Mr. Stevens.
Wonderful story. That's the ideal that we should all aim for. Dignity.
translation.ko: 멋진 얘깁니다, 이상적인 집사의 모습입니다 위엄

translation.en: For you, Mr. Stevens.
Thank you.
It's for Mr. Stevens Sr., Mr. Stevens.
Thank you, Miss Kenton.
Mary.
Put Mr. Stevens Sr.'s plate with cook to keep it warm.
Yes, Miss Kenton.
Thank you.
Not at all, Mr. Stevens.
If you're searching for your dustpan, it is out on the landing.
My dustpan?
Your dustpan. You've left it on the landing.
-I haven't used a dustpan. -Really? It must be somebody else.
translation.ko: - 난 쓴 적 없소 - 그래요? 그럼 다른 사람 짓이군요

translation.en: -I don't follow you. -My mistake, no doubt. One of many.
translation.ko: - 무슨 말을 하는 거요? - 제 실수겠죠, 늘 그렇듯이

translation.en: Morning, sir.
I've invited Giscard Dupont D'Ivry as the French delegate.
He'll never come!
I just had word of his acceptance.
Dupont is fanatically anti-German. His speech in Geneva in '33...
translation.ko: 하지만 듀퐁은 반독일 인사요 1933년 제네바 연설은

translation.en: ...made me ashamed to be an ally of the French.
It's not the English way.
No, it is not.
This is the purpose of our conference, to discuss these matters informally...
translation.ko: 이번 회합의 목적은 국제회의 같은 격식을 떠나

translation.en: ...far from the to-do of an international conference...
...in the friendly and relaxed...
...atmosphere of one's home.
We may bring round the French to our point of view.
And that of the Germans.
I'm sorry to interrupt, but how can we associate with the Germans?
translation.ko: 이렇게 말해 안됐지만 독일과 무슨 대화가 되겠습니까?

translation.en: With the Nazi Party! They have torn up and trampled every treaty...
...and are a growing threat to Europe, not to mention a brutal dictatorship.
My dear boy, when I was in Berlin, I saw at last a happy German people...
translation.ko: 제가 독일에 갔을 때 안정적인 삶을 구가하며

translation.en: ...with jobs, bread, pride in their country and love of their leader.
And what about the Jews?
Did His Lordship wish to exchange the Chinaman in the cabinet room...
...with the one outside the door?
-Chinaman? -Yes.
The Chinaman from the cabinet room is outside this door. See for yourself.
translation.ko: 그 중국 인물상이 밖에 있어요 직접 보시죠

translation.en: I'm busy at the moment.
Just pop your head outside this door and see for yourself.
-I'll look into the matter in due course. -You think it's a fantasy?
A fantasy on my part due to my inexperience?
I'm busy in this room, Miss Kenton.
I shall wait.
Outside.
Look!
-Is that not the wrong Chinaman? -I am very busy.
Have you nothing better to do than stand around?
translation.ko: 이렇게 서성댈 만큼 할 일이 없소?

translation.en: Look at it and tell me the truth.
Keep your voice down. What would the other servants think...
...of us shouting about a Chinaman?
And I would ask you...
...to turn around and look at the Chinaman.
It is a small mistake.
Your father is entrusted with more than he can cope with.
translation.ko: 당신 부친은 이 일에 맞지 않아요

translation.en: Let me pass.
Your father left the dustpan on the floor.
translation.ko: 당신 부친께선 쓰레받기를 계단 한가운데 두질 않나

translation.en: He left polish on the cutlery and confused the Chinaman.
translation.ko: 식기 닦는 걸 잊더니 이젠 인물상을 여기 뒀어요

translation.en: Recognize this before he commits a major error!
translation.ko: 큰 사고를 치기 전에 손을 써야 해요!

translation.en: -You can't talk to me like this. -I'm afraid I must.
I'm giving you serious advice.
Your father should be relieved of a number of his duties for his own good.
translation.ko: 당신 아버지의 업무량을 줄일 필요가 있습니다

translation.en: Whatever he once was, he no longer has the same ability or strength.
translation.ko: 예전에 어땠든 간에 이젠 기력이 많이 쇠했어요

translation.en: I thank you for your advice.
Perhaps now I can go about my business.
I never meant to keep you from your business.
Thank you.
It's vital that we've agreed a common policy before the arrival of...
translation.ko: 그 프랑스 대표가 오기 전에 합의를 봐야 합니다

translation.en: -...your Frenchman. What's his name? -Giscard Dupont D'Ivry.
translation.ko: - 그 사람 이름이 뭐였죠? - 지스카르 듀퐁 디브리

translation.en: We also expect the American delegate...
...Congressman Lewis, to arrive on the same day.
translation.ko: 하원의원 루이스라고 같은 날 도착할 겁니다

translation.en: Who is he, this American?
He's an unknown quantity. A young congressman from Pennsylvania.
translation.ko: 잘은 모르겠지만 펜실베이니아 출신의 젊은 하원의원이죠

translation.en: Sits on some sort of powerful Foreign Affairs Committee.
Heir to one of those American fortunes.
-Meatpacking? -Trolley cars?
Or dry goods?
What are dry goods?
Something that Americans make a lot of money in.
No, I think Mr. Lewis' fortune comes from cosmetics, actually.
translation.ko: 아뇨, 화장품 회사를 가지고 있다고 들었습니다

translation.en: It's old Mr. Stevens!
Get a cushion, quickly. A blanket!
The silver! The silver!
Oh, my lord. Sorry.
You'll be all right.
Thank you, sir. I'm sorry. What happened?
-He tripped with the tray. -I saw it from the window.
This has never happened before.
-May I telephone the doctor? -Yes, do.
-I'm sorry. -Don't worry.
I'm sorry.
Oh, Stevens.
Your father feeling better?
He's made a full recovery.
Good.
We don't wish to see anything of that sort ever happen again, do we?
-I mean, your father collapsing. -Indeed not, my lord.
And it could happen anywhere.
At any time.
The first of the foreign delegates will be here in less than a fortnight.
translation.ko: 이제 보름 후면 외국 사절들이 여기 올 걸세

translation.en: -We are well prepared, my lord. -I'm sure you are.
What happens within this house could have...
...considerable repercussions on the course that Europe takes.
It means a great deal.
And it means a great deal to me personally.
I had a German friend, Karl-Heinz Bremann.
We fought on opposite sides in the war.
We always said when it was over, we'd sit down and have a drink...
translation.ko: 우린 늘 전쟁이 끝나면 술이나 한잔하자고 약속했지

translation.en: ...like gentlemen.
The Versailles Treaty made a liar of me.
translation.ko: 베르사유 조약 때문에 약속을 지킬 수 없었네

translation.en: Yes, a liar, Stevens.
Because the terms we imposed were so harsh that Germany was finished.
One doesn't do that to a defeated foe.
Once your man's on the canvas, it ought to be over.
My friend Bremann was ruined by inflation.
Couldn't get a job in postwar Germany.
Killed himself.
Shot himself in a railway carriage between Hamburg and Berlin.
translation.ko: 함부르크와 베를린 사이 철도에서 권총 자살을 했어

translation.en: Since then, I've felt it my duty to help Germany and to give her...
translation.ko: 그 이후로 난 독일을 도울 의무가 있음을 느꼈다네

translation.en: ...a fair chance.
So this conference is crucial...
...and we can't run the risk of any accidents.
There's no question of your father leaving.
You're simply being asked to reconsider his duties.
Of course, my lord. I understand fully.
Good.
I'll leave you to think about it, then, Stevens.
Thank you, sir.
-You. -Sir?
I'm short-handed in the dining room. I can use you in the servery.
translation.ko: 식당에 일손이 부족하네 식사 시중을 들도록 하게

translation.en: -Thank you, Mr. Stevens, sir. -Smarten up. Look sharp.
translation.ko: - 감사합니다, 스티븐스 씨 - 실수 없어야 하네

translation.en: Good morning.
Good morning.
I might've known you'd be up and ready for the day.
I've been up for two hours.
-That's not much sleep. -It's all the sleep I need.
I've come to talk to you.
Talk, then. I haven't got all morning.
-I'll come straight to the point. -Do, and be done with it.
Some of us have work to be getting on with.
There's to be a very important conference in this house next week.
translation.ko: 다음 주에 이 집에서 중요한 회의가 있어요

translation.en: People of great stature will be His Lordship's guests.
We must all put our best foot forward.
Because of Father's recent accident...
...it has been suggested that you no longer wait at table.
I've waited at table every day...
...for the last 54 years.
It has also been decided that you should no longer carry heavy trays.
Now, here's a revised list of your duties.
translation.ko: 여기 아버지가 하실 일이 적혀 있어요

translation.en: Look, I fell...
...because of those paving stones.
They're crooked.
Why don't you get them put right before someone else falls?
translation.ko: 다른 사람이 다치지 않도록 그것부터 치우거라

translation.en: You will read the revised list of your duties.
Get those stones put right.
You don't want those "gentlemen of stature" breaking their necks.
translation.ko: 저명인사라는 분들이 목이라도 부러지면 안 되잖니?

translation.en: No, indeed, I don't.
Mr. Stevens?
What is it?
You have what we can call a roving commission.
In other words, you can exercise your own judgment...
...within certain limits, of course.
Now, here are the mops, and.... Here.
-Are these me mops? -Right. Your brushes.
And me brushes?
-And me mops. -That's right.
What do you want me to do with them?
I think you know what to do with them, Father. Look for dust and dirt.
translation.ko: 잘 알고 계시잖아요 청소를 하는 거죠

translation.en: If I find any dust or dirt...
...I go over them with this mop.
That's right.
Now, I suggest you start off...
...with the brasses on the doors.
There's that door there. Then the door that's open.
And then there's this door here....
Here's your polish. And duster.
History could well be made under this roof over the next few days.
Each and every one of you...
...can be proud of the role you will play on this occasion.
Imagine yourself the head of a battalion...
...even if it is only filling the hot-water bottles.
Each one has his own particular duty...
...or her particular duty, as the cap fits.
Polished brass, brilliant silver, mahogany shining like a mirror.
translation.ko: 문고리를 닦고 은 광택을 내고 마호가니를 닦고

translation.en: That is the welcome we will show these foreign visitors...
...to let them know they are in England...
...where order and tradition still prevail.
Thank you, Brian.
My lord?
Mr. Lewis, the American, has arrived.
He was expected tomorrow. What have you done with him?
translation.ko: 내일 오기로 돼 있는데 지금 어디 있지?

translation.en: Mr. Lewis has been shown upstairs.
Oh, Stevens?
My godson, Cardinal, will shortly become engaged to be married.
translation.ko: 내 대자 카디널이 곧 약혼식을 할 거네

translation.en: Indeed, sir. I offer my congratulations.
Thank you, Stevens.
I feel very responsible for the boy.
He is my godson, and his father was my closest friend, as you know.
translation.ko: 내 대자이자, 그 애 부친과는 절친한 친구였거든

translation.en: And now that he's gone, well...
...I feel in place of a father to him.
I've appointed him as my secretary at the conference.
He's been jolly thorough in helping me to prepare.
I realize this is a somewhat irregular thing to ask you to do.
translation.ko: 이런 부탁을 하는 게 좀 이례적인 일이긴 하지만...

translation.en: I'd be glad to be of any assistance.
I'm sorry to bring this up...
...but I just can't see how on earth to make it go away.
You are familiar with the facts of life?
translation.ko: 자네 성의 실태에 대해 잘 알고 있나?

translation.en: -My lord? -The facts of life.
Birds, bees. You are familiar, aren't you?
translation.ko: 새와 꽃 자네 잘 알지 않나?

translation.en: I'm afraid I don't quite follow you.
Let me put my cards on the table.
I'm so busy with this conference. Of course, you are too...
translation.ko: 난 회의 준비로 매우 바쁘네 물론 자네도 그렇겠지

translation.en: ...but someone has to tell him.
In a way, it would be easier for you.
Less awkward.
I'd find the task rather daunting, I'm afraid.
I might not get to it before Reginald's wedding day.
Of course, this goes far beyond the call of duty.
I shall do my best.
I'd be grateful if you'd try. It'd be a lot off my mind.
translation.ko: 그렇다면 한 시름 놓을 수 있겠군

translation.en: There's no need to make a song and dance of it. Just convey the facts.
translation.ko: 너무 많은 것들은 말고 기초상식만 말해주면 되네

translation.en: God! Stevens!
Sorry. Most sorry, sir...
...but I do have something to convey to you rather urgently.
If I may, I'll come to the point.
Perhaps you noticed this morning the ducks and the geese by the pond?
translation.ko: 아마 아침에 보셨을 테지만 연못가에 있는 오리와 거위 말입니다

translation.en: Ducks and geese? I don't think so.
translation.ko: 오리와 거위? 못 본 거 같은데

translation.en: Well, perhaps the birds and the flowers, then...
...or the shrubs, the bees....
I've not seen any bees.
-It's not the best time to see them. -What, the bees?
translation.ko: 하긴 계절이 좀 이르긴 합니다 벌 말인가?

translation.en: What I'm saying is that, with the arrival of spring...
...we shall see a most remarkable and profound change...
...in the surroundings.
I'm sure that's right. I'm sure the grounds are not at their best now.
translation.ko: 맞아요, 아직 여기선 잘 느낄 수 없지만요

translation.en: I wasn't paying attention to the glories of nature...
translation.ko: 난 자연현상에 신경을 쓸 겨를이 없네

translation.en: ...because it's worrying....
Dupont D'Ivry has arrived in a foul mood, the last thing anyone wants.
-M. Dupont D'Ivry has arrived? -Half an hour ago, in a foul mood.
translation.ko: 듀퐁 씨가 도착하셨나요? 30분 전에 언짢은 얼굴로 말이야

translation.en: In that case, excuse me. I'd better go and attend to him.
Right you are. Kind of you to talk to me.
Not at all. I've one or two words more to convey on the topic of...
...as you put it most admirably... ...the glories of nature.
But it must wait for another occasion.
I'll look forward to it. But I'm more of a fish man.
-Fish? -I know all about fish.
Freshwater and salt.
All living creatures would be relevant to our discussion.
Excuse me. I had no idea that Monsieur Dupont D'Ivry had arrived.
Thank you.
May I be of assistance, sir?
Oh, the butler.
I have sore feet, so I need a basin with warm water and salts, please.
translation.ko: 발이 부었어 대야에다가 따뜻한 소금물을 부탁하네

translation.en: I'll arrange that with the housekeeper, sir.
Warm water and salts as soon as possible.
translation.ko: 가능한 한 빨리 소금물을 좀 갖다 줘

translation.en: How do you do? But I speak English.
Good. That's lucky for me. I'm Jack Lewis, the U.S. delegate.
Could we speak privately soon?
Yes, of course.
But I have blisters due to some sightseeing they made me do in London.
translation.ko: 하지만 우선 런던 관광하느라 생긴 이 물집부터 처리를 해야겠소

translation.en: I had already seen the Tower of London.
I've discovered that things are not moving...
translation.ko: 하루 일찍 도착해서 보니 전반적인 회의 일정이

translation.en: ...in a direction that I think you would approve of.
German rearmament is a fact to be accepted.
It's in our own interest to have a free and equal Germany.
translation.ko: 우리는 자유롭고 강한 독일에 관심이 있습니다

translation.en: Not a prostrate nation...
...upon whom an unfair peace treaty was imposed 16 years ago.
Those who've been in Germany...
...can only thrill, as I have, to the signs of rebirth.
--to assist Germany in her virile struggle for economic recovery...
...including support for her fair demand for equality of armaments...
translation.ko: 동등한 자격으로 재무장하는 걸 도와주는 것이

translation.en: ...and universal military service for German youth.
If we, in postwar Europe....
I need more water. I need another basin to bathe my feet.
translation.ko: 물 좀 갖다 주겠나? 한 대야가 더 필요하네

translation.en: Follow me, sir.
Excuse me.
-We have to talk. -This way, sir.
My friend, I am in agony. Too tight shoes. I blame myself.
translation.ko: 난 지금 정신없소 신발이 너무 작아 누굴 탓하겠어

translation.en: Vanity.
We must do some fast maneuvering to restrain the Germans.
translation.ko: 독일 통제책을 마련하려면 서둘러 움직여야 할 겁니다

translation.en: Please come this way, gentlemen.
Butler, please, could you help me with my feet-- Shoe?
translation.ko: 집사, 신 벗는 걸 좀 도와주겠나?

translation.en: -Yes, of course. -Take it off.
What they said about equality of arms for Germany, military service--
translation.ko: 독일의 재무장 건에 대해 다들 지지하고 나선다면

translation.en: -Sorry, sir. -I'll manage.
What?
Your father's been taken ill, sir.
-Where? -Outside the Chinese bedroom, sir.
Germany wants peace as much as we do. She needs peace.
Here, let me help you with that.
Thank you.
Thank you, Charles.
Take a basin of hot water and salts...
...to Mr. D'Ivry in the billiards room. Is that understood?
translation.ko: 당구실에 있는 듀퐁 씨에게 갖다 주겠나?

translation.en: -Yes, Mr. Stevens. -Good. Do it.
Father?
Father?
-Mr. Stevens. -Yes?
I have more time than you to look after him. I've called the doctor.
translation.ko: 바쁘실 테니 제가 봐 드릴게요 의사를 불렀어요

translation.en: Thank you, Miss Kenton.
Thank you.
-Doctor. -Yes, hello, Stevens.
Your father's not so good, I'm afraid.
If he deteriorates, call me, will you?
How old is he, 70, 72?
-Seventy-five, sir. -I see.
-If he deteriorates, let me know. -I will, sir. Thank you, doctor.
More haste, less speed.
There's something missing.
What is it?
-The spoon from the cruet set, sir. -Good.
Well observed.
Now, never touch the lip of the glass.
Good.
Glass first, and then....
Is everything in hand downstairs?
We're preparing the last dinner of the conference.
You can imagine the kitchen.
-But is everything in hand? -Yes, I think we're up to scratch.
translation.ko: - 잘 돼 가는 거냐? - 별문제 없습니다

translation.en: Are you feeling any better?
There's something I have to tell you.
I have so much to do. Why don't we talk in the morning?
translation.ko: 지금은 바빠요 내일 얘기하는 게 어떨까요?

translation.en: Jim...
...I fell out of love with your mother.
I loved her once.
The love went out of me when I found her carrying on.
translation.ko: 바람이 난 걸 알고는 정이 떨어졌었지

translation.en: A good son.
Proud of you.
I hope I've been a good father.
I tried me best.
You better get down there...
...or heaven only knows what they'll be up to.
Go on.
Go on!
We'll talk in the morning.
On the last day of our conference...
...permit me to say how impressed I have been...
...with the spirit of goodwill that has prevailed.
translation.ko: 얼마나 인상 깊었는지 말씀을 드리고 싶습니다

translation.en: Goodwill for Germany.
And with tears in my eyes...
...I see that everyone here has recognized...
...our right to be, once again, a strong nation.
translation.ko: 독일의 재기와 부흥을 바란다는 것을 확인했습니다

translation.en: With my hand on my heart, I declare...
...that Germany needs peace...
...and desires only peace.
Peace with England...
...and peace with France.
Thank you very much.
I, too, have been impressed...
...yes, deeply impressed...
...by the genuine desire for peace manifested at this conference.
Unlike our American colleague...
...we in Europe know the horrors of war.
translation.ko: 우리 유럽은 전쟁의 공포를 알고 있습니다

translation.en: And whether we are French or English or Italian or German...
...our one desire is to never have to experience them again.
translation.ko: 유럽인들은 그런 일이 되풀이되기를 바라지 않습니다

translation.en: Indeed.
Impressed, or I may say touched...
...by the words of goodwill and friendship I have heard...
translation.ko: 우호와 선의에 대해 깊은 감명을 받았습니다

translation.en: ...I promise you that I shall do my utmost...
...to change my country's policy...
...towards that nation which was once our foe...
translation.ko: 노력할 것을 약속합니다 독일은 한때 적이었으나

translation.en: ...but is now, I may venture to say...
...our friend.
Ladies and gentlemen...
...the United States doesn't want war any more than you do.
On the other hand, neither do we want peace at any price...
translation.ko: 하지만 평화를 위해서 상상할 수 없는

translation.en: ...because some prices, you may find...
...are too outrageously high to pay.
But let's not get into that now. We may have to soon enough.
translation.ko: 지금은 그런 얘긴 하지 맙시다 곧 기회가 올 겁니다

translation.en: For the moment, let us raise our glasses to Lord Darlington...
translation.ko: 이제 잔을 들고 달링턴 경이 보여준

translation.en: ...in gratitude for his magnificent hospitality.
-Lord Darlington. -Lord Darlington.
Lord Darlington....
Lord Darlington is a classic English gentleman of the old school.
Decent and honorable and well-meaning.
So are all of you. All decent, honorable and well-meaning gentlemen.
translation.ko: 여러분도 마찬가집니다 다들 점잖고 선량하신 분들이죠

translation.en: It's a pleasure and a privilege to visit with you here.
But...
...now, excuse me, I must say this...
...you are, all of you, amateurs.
And international affairs should never be run by gentlemen amateurs.
translation.ko: 국제적 정치 현안은 아마추어들이 움직이지 않습니다

translation.en: Do you have any idea of what sort of a place the world is becoming?
The days when you could act out of noble instincts are over.
translation.ko: 점잔 빼며 예의를 차리던 시절은 끝났습니다

translation.en: Europe has become the arena of Realpolitik, the politics of reality.
translation.ko: 유럽은 지금 현실정치의 실험대로 변하고 있습니다

translation.en: If you like real politics.
What you need is not gentlemen politicians, but real ones.
translation.ko: 지금 필요한 건 신사가 아니라 정치꾼들입니다

translation.en: You need professionals, or you're headed for disaster.
translation.ko: 진정한 정치인들이 없다면 결과는 참담할 겁니다

translation.en: So I propose a toast, gentlemen...
...to the professionals.
-Mr. Stevens. -What?
Well, I've no wish to enter into a quarrel...
...on our last evening together.
But let me say this. What you describe as amateurism...
...is what I think most of us here still prefer to call honor.
Miss Kenton would like to see you concerning your father.
translation.ko: 켄턴 양이 아버님 문제로 할 말이 있대요

translation.en: I suggest that your professionalism means greed and power...
...rather than to see justice and goodness prevail in the world.
I've never concealed from myself that what we were asking of Germany...
translation.ko: 한치의 숨김도 없이 말하건대 우리는 독일과

translation.en: ...is a complete break from the tradition of this country. Thank you.
-Miss Kenton. -Yes.
Mr. Stevens, I'm very sorry.
Your father passed away four minutes ago.
Oh, I see.
I'm so very sorry.
I wish there was something I could say.
Will you come up and see him?
Well, I'm very busy at the moment. In a little while, perhaps.
translation.ko: 지금은 좀 바쁘군요 나중에 보도록 하죠

translation.en: In that case, will you permit me to close his eyes?
I would be most grateful. Thank you.
My father would wish me to carry on. I can't let him down.
translation.ko: 아버지도 일하길 바라실 거요 실망하게 할 순 없소

translation.en: No. Of course.
I'd really like to continue our little chat sometime.
translation.ko: 우리 언제 그 얘기를 다시 해보는 게 어떤가?

translation.en: About nature.
You're right. I should come back when everything's burgeoning.
translation.ko: 당신 말대로 만물이 소생하는 계절이 온 거 같아

translation.en: Yes, sir. Indeed.
As I said before, my main interest has always been in fish.
When I was small, I kept tropical fish in a tank.
I harbored quite a passion for them.
I'll have another drop of that, if you don't mind.
translation.ko: 술 한 잔 더 할 수 있겠나?

translation.en: You all right?
I'm perfectly all right.
Not feeling unwell?
No, sir. A little tired, perhaps.
Wonderful!
What a beautiful example of German culture you've brought to this house.
translation.ko: 멋진 독일문화를 내 집에서 체험하게 되는군요

translation.en: Very nice.
I hope there's no hard feelings.
Oh, my dear good chap.
I like a good, clean fight. Giving as good as one gets, what?
I have the greatest respect for the English. I love it here.
My family brought us here as kids, so I feel at home.
translation.ko: 어릴 적 가족과 함께 와봐서 마치 고향에 온 거 같습니다

translation.en: Anyway, thank you.
Excuse me.
You all right?
Yes, perfect, my lord.
You coming down with a cold or something?
It's been a long day.
It's been a hard day for both of us.
-Well done. -Thank you sir.
-Darlington. -Trimmer.
-Miss Kenton. -Mr. Stevens.
My condolences.
It was a stroke. A severe stroke. He wouldn't have suffered much pain.

Please leave me alone.
Why won't you show me your book?
This is my private time. You're invading it.
-Is that so? -Yes.
-I'm invading your private time, am I? -Yes.
What's in that book?
Come on, let me see.
Or are you protecting me? Is that what you're doing?
translation.ko: 내가 놀랄까 봐 그래요? 그런 거예요?

translation.en: Would I be shocked?
Would it ruin my character?
Let me see it.
Oh, dear.
It's not scandalous at all.
It's just a sentimental old love story.
Yes.
I read these books...
...any books...
...to develop my command and knowledge of the English language.
I read to further my education, Miss Kenton.
I really must ask you, please...
...not to disturb the few moments I have to myself.
Come in.
What is it?
I'm wanting to give you my notice, please.
Why?
Charlie and me, we're getting married.
Oh, Lizzie....
Have you thought about this carefully?
Yes, Miss Kenton, I have.
You've been getting on well here and could have a fine career before you.
translation.ko: 적응도 잘해왔고 이 일이 잘 맞잖아

translation.en: Charlie and me's getting married.
Charlie and I.
I wish I knew what to say to you.
I've seen this happen so many times.
A young girl rushing into marriage only to be disappointed in the end.
translation.ko: 젊은 혈기에 결혼했다가 후회하는 경우 말이야

translation.en: What about money?
We don't have any.
But who cares?
You'll find it's not easy to live poor.
translation.ko: 가난하게 사는 삶이 얼마나 힘든지 몰라서 그래

translation.en: We have each other.
That's all anyone can ever need.
Very well.
If you're so sure.
Yes, Miss Kenton.
Thank you.
Good luck.
We did all we could for them.
translation.ko: 우리가 할 수 있는 건 다했소

translation.en: I told him...
...I had my eye on him as a possible under-butler...
...in a year or so.
But, no, Mr. Charlie knows best.
She's sure to be let down.
No use crying over spilt milk.
Besides, we have far more important matters to discuss.
translation.ko: 그럼 다른 중요한 얘기들을 하도록 하죠

translation.en: -Next week's meeting. Now-- -Must we discuss it tonight?
translation.ko: - 다음 주에 있을 회의 - 꼭 지금 얘기해야 하나요?

translation.en: Sorry?
I'm tired.
I've had a busy day. Don't you realize that?
I'm very tired.
I'm very, very tired.
Don't you understand?
Miss Kenton, I....
I owe you an apology. I thought...
...these quiet evening talks were useful to our work.
translation.ko: 조용한 밤을 이용해 업무 얘기나 해볼까 했는데

translation.en: But now I see that they're a burden to you.
I was only saying I was tired tonight.
No, no. You're right.
Our meetings are a burden after a long day.
translation.ko: 힘든 하루였으니 부담이 될 만도 하지

translation.en: Perhaps we'd better discontinue them.
They're useful. It was only tonight.
I thank you for the cocoa.
In the future, we shall communicate only during the day.
If necessary, by written message.
I wish you a very good night.
Mr. Stevens.
I shall be taking my day off tomorrow.
I'll be back in the house by 9:30.
Certainly.
Certainly.
Good night.
I'm glad to be out of it, I can tell you.
translation.ko: 거기서 나와 정말 시원하다고 말하고 싶군요

translation.en: There was something about Sir Geoffrey and his Black Shirts...
...gave me the creeps.
Mr. Stevens says we should run the house...
translation.ko: 스티븐스 씨가 얘기하길 집을 떠날 때는

translation.en: ...and leave the rest where it belongs.
translation.ko: 모든 걸 다 잊고 나와야 한다고 했어요

translation.en: -You don't agree, Mr. Benn. -No.
Nor do I, really.
If I don't like something, I want to say "stuff it"...
...if you'll pardon the expression, Miss Kenton.
But then I suppose I'm not a real professional, like Mr. Stevens.
It's Mr. Stevens' whole life.
Well, it's not mine.
And to tell you the truth...
...I don't want to go back in service.
translation.ko: 다시 하인 일을 하고 싶지 않아요

translation.en: -What would you do instead, Mr. Benn? -Tom's the name.
translation.ko: - 뭘 하실 거죠, 벤 씨? - 톰이라고 불러요

translation.en: Tom.
What employment would you take up?
I'd really like to be on my own.
Start a little shop somewhere, newspapers and tobacco.
translation.ko: 신문이나 담배를 파는 작은 가게를 내거나

translation.en: Or a boarding house in the west country, where I come from.
Clevedon's a good place for a boarding house.
Would I get you another shandy?
Well, it's almost 9:30....
Go on!
It's your day off, isn't it?
You're not in the army, due back in the barracks.
-All right, then. -Good.
Half a shandy, please.
What about yourself, then, Sarah?
That's a serious sort of a name.
They called me Sally when my mum was alive.
Sally. That's nice.
Is it your intention to remain in service?
It's a good profession, when you have a position.
-Mr. Stevens says we're fortunate-- -We're not talking about him.
translation.ko: - 스티븐스 씨가 말하길... - 그 사람 말을 하는 게 아닙니다

translation.en: We're talking about you.
Supposing...
...someone asked if you'd like to come in on a boarding house by the sea?
translation.ko: 누군가가 바닷가에서 같이 하숙집을 하자고 하면

translation.en: What would you say?
Well, I don't know.
It's a theoretical question, so I haven't given it any thought...
translation.ko: 갑작스러운 질문이라 생각해 볼 여유가 없었네요

translation.en: -...Mr. Benn. -Tom.
Supposing it wasn't theoretical...
...Sally?
It's been years since I've been called that. It feels funny.
Nice, though?
Yes.
It's very late.
Will there be anything else?
What?
Oh, Stevens.
No. No.
-Thank you. Good night. -Good night, my lord.
Mr. Cardinal, good evening.
-How are you? -Very well.
-Delighted. And your wife? -Very well too, sir.
-Good evening, sir. -Stevens.
-How are you? -Very well, sir.
I've gone and got myself in a bit of a mess with arrangements.
Would His Lordship put me up?
-I'll tell him you're here. -Thanks.
I hope there's nothing special tonight.
His Lordship expects some gentlemen after dinner.
I'll keep my head down, then. I've got to write my column anyway.
translation.ko: 그럼 난 조용히 기사나 마저 써야겠군

translation.en: -You're in time for dinner, if you like. -I hoped I would be.
How is my godfather? Fit?
Very well. Some refreshment?
Thank you. Some whiskey would be lovely.
-Who's he expecting tonight? -I am unable to help you there.
What, no idea?
No idea at all, sir.
-I'll keep my head down all the same. -I think it's a good idea, sir.
Come in.
Ah, Miss Kenton.
Mr. Cardinal has just arrived, out of the blue.
He'll expect his usual room.
-I'll see to it before I leave. -You're going out?
I am indeed.
It's Thursday.
Of course. I'd forgotten. Sorry.
Is something the matter?
No, no.
Some visitors are arriving, but it doesn't involve you.
We agreed that Thursday is my day off...
...but if you need me urgently--
No, it's perfectly all right. Thank you.
-Mr. Stevens. -Yes?
I have something to tell you.
My friend...
...the man I'm meeting, Mr. Benn.
Mr. Benn. Of course. Yes.
He has asked me to marry him.
I am thinking about it.
I see.
He's moving to the west country next month.
I'm still thinking about it.
I thought you should be informed of the situation.
translation.ko: 당신이 알고 있어야 할 거 같아서요

translation.en: Yes, thank you.
That's most kind of you.
Well....
I trust you'll have a most pleasant evening.
Thank you.
Is there something special tonight?
Are your visitors special?
Can't tell you, my boy. Strictly confidential.
-So I can't sit in on it? -On what?
-Whatever it is that's taking place. -Absolutely not.
Can't have someone like you sticking your nose in. A journalist.
translation.ko: 자네 같은 기자를 낄 순 없지

translation.en: What do you call it, a "newshound"?
No, it wouldn't do at all.
Once you've had your food, you'd better make yourself scarce.
translation.ko: 식사를 하고 나서 네 방에 가 있으렴

translation.en: It sounds pretty special to me.
Good evening, prime minister.
-Sorry, we've been delayed. -I understand.
Lord Halifax.
-Very nice to see you. -This is Mr. Fraser.
How do you do, Mr. Fraser?
Good evening, Your Excellency.
Please wait here, Your Excellency. I'll inform His Lordship.
Thank you.
-Ambassador. -Lord Darlington.
How do you do?
We don't intend to involve the whole British Empire in a war...
...simply because of a quarrel in a faraway country...
...between people of whom we know nothing.
To my mind, the whole of Czechoslovakia...
...isn't worth a single one of our own young men.
We have a small, noisy and corrupt war group here...
...who don't realize that you Germans are marching into your own back yard.
translation.ko: 옳은 일을 하고 있는 독일의 입장을 몰라서 그러는 겁니다

translation.en: The Führer is a man of peace to the depth of his soul...
...but he won't allow a small second-rate country...
translation.ko: 천 년 역사의 독일을 체코 같은 이류 국가가

translation.en: ...to thumb its nose at the 1000-year German Reich.
I'll get it.
Come on, wake up!
Stay awake!
Could you confirm that this lady is on the staff here?
Yes, of course. She's the housekeeper.
Thank you, sir.
-May I? -Of course.
Sorry to have alarmed you.
Just security, miss.
I trust you've had a pleasant evening.
Well, did you have a pleasant evening?
-Yes, thank you. -Good.
Would you like to know what took place?
I have to return upstairs.
There are important events taking place tonight.
When are there not?
-I accepted his proposal. -Miss Kenton?
I accepted Mr. Benn's proposal of marriage.
My congratulations.
I am prepared to serve out my notice.
But if you'd release me earlier, I'd be grateful.
Mr. Benn is planning to leave for the west country in two weeks.
I'll do my best.
Now, please excuse me.
-Mr. Stevens. -Yes, Miss Kenton?
After all the years I have been here, you have nothing else to say?
translation.ko: 꽤 오랫동안 같이 있었는데 할 말이 없나요?

translation.en: You have my warmest congratulations.
You've been a very important figure...
...for Mr. Benn and me.
Oh, in what way?
I tell him all sorts of things about you.
I tell him stories about you. About your habits.
About your mannerisms.
He finds it very funny, especially when I show him how...
translation.ko: 특히 당신이 후추를 뿌릴 때 코를 쥔다고 하니까

translation.en: ...you pinch your nose when you put pepper on your food.
That always has us in stitches.
Does it, indeed?
Well, please...
...excuse me, Miss Kenton.
Good night.
Thanks.
We've been friends a long time, haven't we?
Yes, sir.
I always look forward to a chat when I come here.
translation.ko: 여기 올 때마다 자네와 대화를 하고 싶었지

translation.en: Would you care to join me in a drink?
That's most kind of you, but no, thank you.
You all right?
I'm perfectly all right.
Not feeling unwell, are you?
No, no. A little tired, perhaps.
I bet you're tired. What is it, about 1:00?
Come on.
I want you to sit down.
Well, sir, I really--
Look....
I didn't come here by accident.
You know that.
I had a tip-off, you see...
...about what's going on now in the library.
translation.ko: 모임에 대해 들은 정보가 있어서 그래

translation.en: I wish you'd sit down. I'm your friend...
...and you're holding that tray as if you're about to wander off!
translation.ko: 어디 갈 것처럼 그렇게 서 있지 말고

translation.en: Now, come on. Sit down, damn it!
That's better.
Now, look, I don't suppose the prime minister is in the library, is he?
Prime minister, sir?
In the library-- You don't have to confirm it--
--are our prime minister, our foreign secretary and the German ambassador.
-Any idea what they're talking about? -I'm afraid not.
Tell me, Stevens, don't you care at all?
Aren't you in the least bit curious?
It's not my place to be curious about such matters.
Not your place.
And supposing I told you that His Lordship...
...is trying to persuade the prime minister...
...to enter into a pact with that bunch of criminals in Berlin?
I'm certain His Lordship is acting from the highest and noblest motives.
Don't you see? That's exactly what makes it so abominable!
Twisting these high and noble motives to their own foul ends!
You do, please, realize that His Lordship's been the most...
...valuable pawn that the Nazis have in this country...
...precisely because he is good and honorable?
If I weren't so drunk, I could make you understand!
translation.ko: 취하지만 않았어도 자네를 납득하게 할 수 있을 텐데

translation.en: Sir...
...I do understand.
His Lordship is working to ensure peace in our time.
Peace in our time on their beastly terms!
Remember that American here at the conference?
Called Lord Darlington an amateur, out of his depth?
Well, he was right.
He was dead right.
I hardly have to tell you how I feel towards His Lordship.
I care about him deeply, and I know you do too.
translation.ko: 난 대부님을 존경하네 자네도 마찬가지일 거야

translation.en: Yes, I do indeed.
Then aren't you desperate to see him make this mistake?
translation.ko: 그런 대부님이 실수하는 걸 보는 내 심정은 어떻겠나?

translation.en: He's being tricked! Don't you see? Or are you as deluded as he is?
translation.ko: 함정에 빠지고 계셔 자네 모르겠나? 자네 눈뜬장님이야?

translation.en: Oh, dear. Now I've probably offended you.
No. Not at all, sir.
Not at all.
You must excuse me.
There are other gentlemen calling for me, sir.
You mustn't take anything I said to heart.
translation.ko: 제가 한 말 신경 쓰지 마세요

translation.en: I was very foolish a little while ago.
Miss, Kenton, I haven't taken anything you said to heart.
In fact, I can hardly recall anything you did say.
I was just being very foolish.
I simply haven't time to stand here with you, engaging in idle talk.
translation.ko: 지금은 바빠서 얘기를 할 시간이 없군요

translation.en: I suggest you go to bed now. You must be very tired.
Good night, Miss Kenton.
Oh, damn it!
Blast!
Miss Kenton....
Yes, Mr. Stevens.
Miss Kenton, I....
I'd been wanting to tell you....
It's the small alcove outside the breakfast room.
translation.ko: 간이 식당 밖에 있는 작은 창고 말이오

translation.en: It's the new girl, of course...
...but I find it has not been dusted in some time.
I'll see to it.
Thank you.
I knew you would have wanted to be informed.
Miss Kenton.
Hello, Sally.
Hi, Tom.
-You all right, then? -Yes.
How are you?
I'm good.
Could we...?
Could we talk for a moment, please? Just for a moment.
We'll have to be quick because I'm going out.
It won't take long.
All right, then. We'll have to go into the lounge.
-Afternoon. -Hello.
Nice little place, isn't it?
The sort of quiet little boarding house I had in mind for us.
Like other things, it didn't work out.
What did you want to say?
I saw Catherine yesterday. She had some interesting news.
translation.ko: 어제 캐서린을 만났죠 좋은 소식이 있더군요

translation.en: -She's expecting. -Oh, my goodness!
She wants us both over for tea on Sunday.
I could come and get you.
We could go together on the bus.
translation.ko: 같이 버스 타고 가면 될 거예요

translation.en: Yes, well, we'll see about that.
House is that empty without you.
I can't tell you.
You cut yourself shaving.
Oh, yeah. I know.
Can't seem to do anything right these days.
translation.ko: 제대로 되는 게 하나도 없지요, 뭐

translation.en: I so often think of the good old days...
...when I was housekeeper at Darlington Hall.
translation.ko: 달링턴 저택에서 총무 일을 하던 때가

translation.en: Those years with you were the happiest of my life.
Would you like more tea?
Yes, please. Thank you.
Miss Kenton. I'm sorry, Mrs. Benn.
-Sorry, I was delayed. -That's all right.
Please sit down.
-I've ordered some fresh tea. -Lovely.
-Would you like some cake? -No, thank you.
-Sure? -All right. It's a special occasion.
Good.
Waitress?
-Could we have some cake? -Yes, of course.
translation.ko: - 케이크 좀 갖다 주겠소? - 네, 손님

translation.en: -It's been a long time. -Yes, indeed.
You haven't changed at all.
Well....
A little, perhaps.
We've all changed, I think.
I'd have known you anywhere.
How long's it been? Twenty years?
Yes, just over, I think.
The tea should be along.
We read about the suit for libel.
It's a shame...
...calling His Lordship a traitor. Those papers will print anything.
translation.ko: 매국노라고 하다니 그렇게 아무거나 쓰는 신문은

translation.en: They should have lost the case.
Yes.
When His Lordship went to court...
...he sincerely expected he would get justice.
Instead, the newspaper increased its circulation, and His Lordship's...
...good name was destroyed forever.
And....
Afterwards, in his last years, well...
...quite honestly, Mrs. Benn...
...his heart was broken.
I'd take him tea in the library, and he'd be sitting there...
...and he wouldn't even see me, so deep was he in his own thoughts.
translation.ko: 때로 깊은 생각에 잠겨 날 보지 못할 때도 있었소

translation.en: And his....
He'd be talking to himself... ...as though he was arguing with someone.
There was no one, of course.
No one came to see him anymore.
What about his godson, young Mr. Cardinal?
Mr. Cardinal was killed in the war. Waitress.
May I have my bill, please?
I'm very sorry.
Yes.
I know you remember Darlington Hall in its best days...
...and that's how His Lordship deserves to be remembered.
But perhaps the good days are back, now that Mr. Lewis is here...
...and Mrs. Lewis is arriving shortly.
Very fortunate to have you running the house.
We still have problems, Miss Kenton. I'm sorry. Mrs. Benn.
translation.ko: 아직도 문제가 많아요, 켄턴 양 아니, 벤 부인

translation.en: -We still have staff problems. -You mentioned it in your letter.
Frankly, I've been thinking of going back in service.
translation.ko: 솔직히 말하면 다시 일을 할까 생각했어요

translation.en: Good--
But now the situation has changed for me.
If I take up any work, it will have to be...
...here in the west country...
...because Catherine, our daughter, is expecting a baby.
So I would like to be near her.
Of course.
And to be near our grandchild as he grows up.
translation.ko: 가까이서 손자가 자라는 걸 지켜봐야 해서요

translation.en: -Naturally. -Or her, if it's a little girl.
When I left Darlington Hall, all those years ago...
...I never realized I was really, truly leaving.
I believe I thought of it as simply another ruse...
...to annoy you.
It was a shock to come out here and find myself actually married.
For a long time, I was...
...very unhappy.
But then Catherine was born, the years went by and one day...
translation.ko: 하지만 캐서린이 태어나고 시간이 지난 어느 날

translation.en: ...I realized I loved my husband.
You see, there is no one...
...no one in the world who needs me as much as he does.
But still there are times...
...when I think I made a terrible mistake with my life.
Yeah.
I'm sure we all have these thoughts...
...from time to time.
Yes.
People always cheer when they turn the lights on in the evening.
translation.ko: 저렇게 불이 켜지면 사람들은 생기에 넘치죠

translation.en: I wonder why.
They do say...
...that for many people, the evening's the best part of the day.
translation.ko: 하루 중 저녁이 가장 좋은 시간이래요

translation.en: The part they most look forward to.
Is that so?
What do you most look forward to?
Getting back to Darlington Hall, principally...
...and straightening out our staff problems.
You were always able to do that.
And you had quite a few to straighten out, as I remember.
Yes.
Always was work, work and more work...
translation.ko: 맞아요, 난 항상 일하고 또 일하고

translation.en: ...and will continue to be so, I have no doubt.
Mr. Stevens, don't you wait! That bus is always late.
translation.ko: 스티븐스 씨, 기다리지 말아요 그 버스는 항상 늦어요

translation.en: Come in out of the wet.
You must take good care of yourself.
-You too, promise me that. -Oh, yes, I promise.
Do all you can to make these years happy for yourself and your husband.
We may never meet again, Mrs. Benn.
That is why I am being personal, if you will forgive me.
translation.ko: 그러다 보니 감상적인 말을 하게 되나 봅니다

translation.en: Thank you, Mr. Stevens.
Oh, here it comes. It's on time for once.
Thank you. And thank you so very much for coming.
It was so very kind of you.
It was so nice to see you.
It was a pleasure to see you again. Goodbye.
Take care.
Goodbye.
Ah, Stevens.
You scared me. Where'd you come from?
Good morning, sir.
You like the suit?
Very good, sir.
Thank you.
Good.
Watch the chandelier there.
Okay.
You're really getting things going here. This is wonderful!
translation.ko: 자네가 오니 일이 되는군 정말 멋진걸

translation.en: Thank you, sir.
I've had to ask another three girls from the village to come up.
And I can promise you that the house will be ready...
...and in shape by the time Mrs. Lewis arrives.
-That sounds good. -Thank you, sir.
I'm expecting a possible new housekeeper this afternoon.
A Mrs. Ruth Muspratt.
Excellent references. She was matron at a boys' school in Sussex.
translation.ko: 추천서도 훌륭하고 서식스에 있는 학교의 사감이었습니다

translation.en: -A matron? -Yes, sir.
Sounds like she'll keep us from misbehaving.
-I certainly hope so, sir. -Good.
Good, Stevens. Very good.
This is where we had that banquet back in '35. Remember?
We all stood up and delivered ourselves of our principles.
God knows what I said. Sure got worked up about it, though.
translation.ko: 내가 얘기를 하자 다들 화를 냈었지

translation.en: What did I say, anyway?
I'm sorry, sir, I was too busy serving...
...to listen to the speeches.
We got a visitor here.
Be very careful.
Come here. That's a boy. Come on.
Okay. Easy does it.
Come on!
I suggest we be quieter.
You don't want to startle it.
It'll come down.
I think if we leave the window open....
Good.
Very still.
Go on. Out! Come on. Out!
Well done.
Well done, sir.
